name: Impoundments / Dams / Ponds
functionStatement: Wetlands and storage features store floodwater, recharge groundwater, sustain baseflow, and provide low-velocity habitat.
descriptionMarkdown: "Presence and proximity of impoundments (dams/ponds/reservoirs) that can alter flow regime, sediment transport, temperature, and aquatic connectivity. Small beaver-type impoundments aid baseflow/habitat; no major fragmentation unless historically normal."
methodContextMarkdown:
Context: Watershed and Floodplain; Channel

Method: Desktop (GIS/imagery and existing datasets); Field
howToMeasureMarkdown: "Inventory impoundments upstream (and where specified, downstream) of the project reach using dam/impoundment datasets and imagery. Summarize proximity and/or density per the metric definition. Assign the condition class using the bin thresholds for this metric. Count beaver dams or ponded sections per 100 m of channel. Use recent aerial imagery to pre-screen and compare to expected capacity for the setting."

inputs.label: Impoundments / Dams / Ponds
inputs.helpMarkdown: "National Inventory of Dams (NID) and/or state dam databases; NHD/NHDPlus waterbodies/flowlines; recent imagery. "

levels.label: Good
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Good: Beaver dams or small ponds enhance baseflow and habitat with negligible fragmentation. (Suggested index range 0.70-1.0)

levels.label: Fair
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Fair: 1-2 small obstructions with minor impacts. / Multiple ponds moderately disrupt connectivity. (Suggested index range 0.40-0.69)

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Poor: Widespread channel fragmentation or overabundant ponding. (Suggested index range 0.0-0.39)

references: Beaver Restoration Assessment Tool (BRAT) for capacity context.
